definition: to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish

sentences.english: Don't you feel to be swabbed everyday " acupuncture point " very troublesome?
sentences.chinese: 你不觉得天天擦洗“穴位”很麻烦吗？

sentences.english: Rub hands together to make a lather and scrub all surfaces.
sentences.chinese: 搓手产生肥皂沫，用力擦洗所有表面。

sentences.english: Moisten the cloth before applying the lotion.
sentences.chinese: 在涂擦洗液之前先把布弄湿。

sentences.english: When swabbing bibcock, do not use dissolvent of soda acid sex.
sentences.chinese: 擦洗龙头时，不要用酸碱性溶剂。

sentences.english: Instead, just deploy an army of autonomous, oil-scrubbing robots.
sentences.chinese: 相反，只需要部署一支自主的原油擦洗机器人小分队。

sentences.english: Residual or process hydrogen chloride within the system should be disposed of using a caustic scrubber.
sentences.chinese: 在系统内的残留氯化氢应该用腐蚀性擦洗器处理。

sentences.english: Rinse with clear water and wipe dry with clean cloth.
sentences.chinese: 以湿布加少量清水擦洗干净，再用清洁湿布抺净。

sentences.english: They cleaned the floor with water mixed with a chemical.
sentences.chinese: 他们用掺有化学药剂的水擦洗地板。

sentences.english: Blade became dirty can swab with soap powder fluid, do not use be brushed forcedly and edge tool goes dirtying.
sentences.chinese: 叶片脏了可用肥皂粉液擦洗，不要用硬刷和利器去垢。

sentences.english: Sponge yourself down, and then take a shower.
sentences.chinese: 先用海绵擦洗一下，再冲淋浴。

sentences.english: Looking at this pathetic scene, her heart broke. Weeping, she urged Tzu-chuan to wash Tai-yu quickly.
sentences.chinese: 李纨目睹惨状，心酸落泪，忙催着紫鹃快给黛玉擦洗。

sentences.english: If there is oil stains in foam detergent scrub, such as cleaning is very short.
sentences.chinese: 如有油迹等用泡沫清洁剂擦洗就好了，保洁很简略。

sentences.english: This floor needs a good scrub.
sentences.chinese: 这地板需要好好地擦洗一番。

sentences.english: Reverse flow of scrubber solution into cylinder must be prevented.
sentences.chinese: 必须防止擦洗器溶液回流入钢瓶。

sentences.english: The crew were ordered to swab down the decks.
The nurse turn the old man over to wash his back.
sentences.chinese: 护士给老人翻个身擦洗后背。

definition: to rub oneself down with a wet towel/to take a sponge bath
